column4: Telefonica says offer for KPN's E-Plus is definitive
column5: MADRID  Aug 9 Spanish telecoms company Telefonica said on Friday it maintained its offer to buy KPN's German business E-Plus under conditions already announced after America Movil launched a $9.6 billion bid to take over KPN.

column4: Canada PM brushes off protests  says spectrum auction to proceed
column5: Aug 9 Canada will sell off wireless spectrum next year as planned  Prime Minister Stephen Harper said on Friday  despite protests by major telecoms firms that the auction rules favor the entry into the market of U.S. giant Verizon Communications Inc.

column4: Time Warner-CBS blackout reaches eighth day  viewers to miss golf major
column5: More than 3 million Time Warner Cable customers in New York  Los Angeles and Dallas will be blocked from watching golf's Major Championship and other popular shows this weekend if the cable company fails to reach an agreement with CBS to end the week-long blackout.

column4: LIVESTOCK-US live cattle futures slip on profit-taking
column5: * Traders step back after Tyson news     * CME live cattle weaken feeders     * Profit taking weakens CME hogs       By Theopolis Waters     CHICAGO  Aug 9 Chicago Mercantile Exchange live cattle futures on Friday dipped on profit-taking  a day after surging to a three-month high after Tyson Foods said it would no longer buy cattle given the feed additive Zilmax  traders and analysts said. column4: LIVESTOCK-US live cattle futures slip on profit-taking
column5: By Theopolis Waters     CHICAGO  Aug 9 Chicago Mercantile Exchange live cattle futures on Friday fell on profit-taking after recent gains fueled by Tyson Foods' plans to no longer buy cattle given the feed additive Zilmax  traders and analysts said.     In a letter to feedlot operators  Tyson Foods Inc  the country's largest meat processor  said it will suspend purchases of cattle given the growth additive Zilmax  starting Sept. 6. column4: Disney's animated adventure 'Planes' enters tailwind of 'Cars'
column5: LOS ANGELES For a film once slated to go straight to DVD  Disney's animated adventure "Planes" has some lofty ambitions: it not only wants to be a worthy spin-off of the "Cars" franchise  it also aspires to tell a global story.

column4: Weight Watchers trying to cash in on desire for healthy workers
column5: NEW YORK Facing increased competition from free calorie-counting apps  Weight Watchers International Inc is targeting a steadily growing market - employers looking for a leaner workforce.

column4: CORRECTED-Weight Watchers trying to cash in on desire for healthy workers
column5: (Corrects CEO's surname in paragraph 12 to Chambers from Chamber)
